apis.description: APIs to retrieve list of events open for betting.

parameters.name: sportId
parameters.description: Use one of the values returned from /sportsList response

parameters.name: eventScheduleId
parameters.description: Event Schedule ID, 1 - Early, 2 - Today, 3 - Live

parameters.name: memberToken
parameters.description: Header Parameter, must be a valid token obtained from login API

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Header Parameter, must be the same user-id used for logging-in

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: Header Parameter, a valid apiKey obtained via /apiKey API

errorResponses.reason: Any one of the above cases, use the errorCode attribute to handle it

operations.notes:
This API won't give the odds/handicap info for each Market and its selections. Please use /event/pricelist for that.

In the response JSON, Binary markets will have values only for marketLines and Non-binary markets will have values only for selections attribute.

Also note, apart from the marketSelectionId, every market selection JSON in the "selections" array, contains an attribute "selectionId". The value of selectionId will be constant for each selection across all market-lines (in-case of the event having sub-lines) whereas the marketSelectionId will vary for every line. The client can make use of these id values to find the odds/handicap values from the get prices JSON response. Also note that groundType value is only available for Soccer events.

The reason behind splitting odds values from the event listing is, the client can simply query the event listing once because unlike the odds values, the event listing is not supposed to change very often. It can then call the get prices API periodically and match the updated odds/handicap values using the id-values in the event listing JSON. The client can make further calls to event listing API, only when new marketIds, marketSelectionIds, selectionIds are found in the get prices API JSON response.

Following JSON response will be returned in case of any error occurs: 

{"errorCode": "string", "errorMessage": "string"}

The HTTP Error code won't give sepcific information about the error condition. Instead the client can make use of the errorCode attribute shown in the above JSON response to identify and handle the error conditions.

List of error codes and messages given below:

errorCodeerrorMessage
100Required header parameters memberToken, userId and apiKey are either missing or invalid.
105Session time out or you have been logged out. Please re-login.
203Invalid Sport ID.
204Invalid Event Schedule ID.

Note: The response Content-Encoding will be gzip for all the Betting API responses, including this one.
operations.summary: Retrieve list of matches by sport and event schedule

apis.description: APIs to retrieve list of events open for betting.

parameters.name: sportId
parameters.description: Use one of the values returned from /sportsList response

parameters.name: oddsGroupId
parameters.description: Use the value of oddsGroupId returned in /member/info response

parameters.name: binaryOddsFormat
parameters.description: Use the value of binaryOddsFormat returned in /member/info response

parameters.name: eventScheduleId
parameters.description: Event Schedule ID, 1 - Early, 2 - Today, 3 - Live

parameters.name: lastRequestKey
parameters.description: Must be the value of lastRequetKey obtained from previous call to this API or the /member/login API.

parameters.name: memberToken
parameters.description: Header Parameter, must be a valid token obtained from login API

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Header Parameter, must be the same user-id used for logging-in

parameters.name: apiKey
parameters.description: Header Parameter, a valid apiKey obtained via /apiKey API

errorResponses.reason: Any one of the above cases, use the errorCode attribute to handle it

operations.notes:
The lastRequestKey is a unique value generated by the server (represents the date-time value when this API was last invoked) and included in the JSON response of this API. The key will expire within 60 seconds.The client must attach a valid active lastRequestKey to retrieve the "Delta list" of changes happened in the market-selections since its last call to this API. Those market-selections that were available in the previous list but unavailable/closed currently will have decimal odds value as 0.00.

For the very first invocation of this API, the lastRequestKey value obtained from /member/login API should be used.

Server will throw a error response, if the lastRequestKey is found to be expired or invalid. In such case the client must re-login to obtain an active lastRequestKey.

Note: The odds format for non-binary markets will always be Decimal (Euro).

Also the client will have to repeat this API for all sportId & eventScheduleId values. The client must use the same lastRequestKey for one set of combination.

List of error codes and messages given below:

errorCodeerrorMessage
100Required header parameters memberToken, userId and apiKey are either missing or invalid.
101Last Request Key expired. Please re-login and obtain a new key.
105Session time out or you have been logged out. Please re-login.
201Invalid Odds Group.
202Invalid Odds Format.
203Invalid Sport ID.
204Invalid Event Schedule ID.

Note: The response Content-Encoding will be gzip for all the Betting API responses, including this one.
operations.summary: Retrieves Odds and handicap info for all Market Selections
